intro: Palaua biserrata, commonly known as the serrated palaua, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its rough, serrated leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands or near water bodies. Palaua biserrata is also valued for its ornamental appeal and has traditional uses in some cultures.
